text: Events in the year 1843 in Belgium. ==Incumbents== *Monarch: Leopold I *Prime Minister: Jean-Baptiste NothombGeorges-Henri Dumont, Chronologie de la Belgique: De 1830 à nos jours (Le Cri, 2017). ==Events== * Pierre-Joseph van Beneden establishes the world's first marine laboratory in Ostend * 12 June – Parliamentary elections * 21 July – Antwerp Zoo established * 7 August – Border convention between Belgium and the Luxembourg concluded at Maastricht.Convention de limites entre la Belgique et le Luxembourg, conclue à Maestricht le 7 aout 1843 (Brussels, Imprimerie du Moniteur Belge, 1844) On Google Books * 8 August – Border convention between Belgium and the Netherlands concluded at Maastricht.Convention de limites entre la Belgique et les Pays-Bas, conclue à Maestricht le 8 aout 1843 (Brussels, Imprimerie du Moniteur Belge, 1844) On Google Books ==Publications== ;Periodicals *Almanach royal de Belgique (Brussels, Librairie Polytechnique)https://books.google.com/books?id=DJtjAAAAcAAJ * La Belgique judiciaire: gazette des tribunaux belges et étrangersOn Google Books * Bulletin et Annales de l'Académie d'Archéologie de Belgique begins publication.Vol. 1 at Internet Archive. *Journal historique et littéraire, vol. 10 (Liège, Pierre Kersten)On Google Books *La renaissance: Chronique des arts et de la littérature, 4.Vols. 3-4 on Google Books. * Revue de Bruxelles changes title to Nouvelle Revue de Bruxelles.On Google Books * Revue nationale de Belgique, Vol. 9On Google Books ;Monographs and reports * État de l'instruction moyenne en Belgique, 1830-1842On Google Books * Notice statistique sur les Journaux Belges: 1830-1842On Google Books * Edward Dobson, An Historical, Statistical, and Scientific Account of the Railways of Belgium from 1834 to 1842 (London, John Weale)On Google Books * Charles Marcellis, Coup d'oeuil sur la Belgique en 1843On Google Books * Pierre-Joseph Van Beneden, Recherches sur l'embryogénie des tubulaires * Pierre-Joseph Van Beneden, Mémoire sur les campanulaires de la côte d'Ostende ;Literature * Henry Robert Addison, Belgium as she is (Brussels and Leipzig, C. Muquardt)On Google Books * Hendrik Conscience, Hoe men schilder wordt * Hendrik Conscience, Wat een Moeder lijden kan ==Births== *18 March – Jules Vandenpeereboom, politician (died 1917) *26 April – Paul de Vigne, sculptor (died 1901) *13 May – Paul de Smet de Naeyer, politician (died 1913) *25 July – Edmond Hanssens, colonial administrator (died 1884) *19 September – Charles van der Stappen, sculptor (died 1910) ==Deaths== *2 March – François-Joseph- Philippe de Riquet (born 1771), prince of Chimay *12 December – William I of the Netherlands (born 1772), former head of state ==References== Category:1840s in Belgium
title: 1843 in Belgium
